parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A couch, bed, portable bed or mat, a couch for reclining at meals, possibly also a bier. From klino; a couch.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
